kayla out

Shadows all around you as you surface from the dark
Emerging from the gentle grip of night's unfolding arms
Darkness, darkness everywhere, do you feel all alone?
The subtle grace of gravity, the heavy weight of stone

You don't see what you possess, a beauty calm and clear
It floods the sky and blurs the darkness like a chandelier
All the light that you possess is skewed by lakes and seas
The shattered surface, so imperfect, is all that you believe

I will bring a mirror, so silver, so exact
So precise and so pristine, a perfect pane of glass
I will set the mirror up to face the blackened sky
You will see your beauty every moment that you rise



I feel like im this close
I discover more as I go along

Its there, and its mine

so thats pretty much what the books are

you(kayleigh) are prob reading this so yeah, check them out
i recommend

inpulse as your first choice
then crank

laters



Love has earth to which she clings
With hills and circling arms about--
Wall within wall to shut fear out.
But Thought has need of no such things,
For Thought has a pair of dauntless wings.

On snow and sand and turn, I see
Where Love has left a printed trace
With straining in the world's embrace.
And such is Love and glad to be
But Thought has shaken his ankles free.

Thought cleaves the interstellar gloom
And sits in Sirius' disc all night,
Till day makes him retrace his flight
With smell of burning on every plume,
Back past the sun to an earthly room.

His gains in heaven are what they are.
Yet some say Love by being thrall
And simply staying possesses all
In several beauty that Thought fares far
To find fused in another star.

well fuck! I'm posting my first chapter anyways. It pretty much sucks and isn't really the direction i want to go in but aww, what the hell? I'm posting this for myself more than anyone else


***side note, every chapter begins with definition of the chapters emotion and usually will end with said word

*** side note, also where ever there is a ________, it is the master vampire but i simply have yet to find a name for him.


Defeat: acceptance or resignation to the prospect of defeat or loss.

Rylee couldn't breathe. All around her, the bodies of her friends, the same people came with her to this hell hole. Dead. Because of her. For three hours straight she heard their screams of pain, their struggles and useless pleading. Her gag had muffled her screams while she strained against the chains, pinning her to the wall.

The sound of footsteps echoed, as they led to the metal door of her chamber. Rylee caught her breathe, as the door opened and Master_______, treaded carefully into the room, fresh blood on his smirking lips. He laughed as she jerked away from his presence, while he undid her chains and released her gag. Rylee gasped as pain washed over her when she collapsed to the cold floor with a Thud. ______ squated next to her, closing his eyes as the smell of lingering fear, anger, and grief filled his nostrils. Giving a little laugh while merriment filled his eyes, he lowered his mouth to her shaking body and sung softly in her ear.

"Little Rylee filled with sorrow
No precious friends to see tomorrow
Oh what will little Rylee do?
Alone in here, with just us two"


Smirking at his quick witted song, ________ stood up, and spoke with a commanding voice.

"Maybe now, with your fellow slaves dead, you can focus your attentions on your love for me" he said as he was certain this was the end of her struggles with his dominance.
A
s the last of Rylee's hope of ever being freed disappeared with her friend's lives, a grim determination settled in her eyes while glaring at his eternally youthful face.

"I will NEVER love you" she spat, anger slowly filling her as she tried to crawl away from him. Chuckling to himself, ________ grabbed her by the hair, and threw her harshly against the corner of the stone wall. Shaking his head disbelief of her disobedience, he saundered to the chamber door, closing the door behind him, just as he whispered loud enough for her to hear.

"I don't need your love, precious Rylee. When I have your soul"

As soon as the door slammed from his forceful hands, did Rylee let the tears fall down. Sobbing for the friends she had lost, and the life she once knew, she could only describe her emotions in one word.






Defeat.






end of chapter..
